intro: Parascheelea anchistropetala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved orchid, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with a distinctive coloration that varies from white to pale yellow. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
